page.title: 05Hop Drying in Brenchley
page.content: The stems of the hop plants are brought to the hop picking shed and fed into a machine.{The hop stripping {machine at Tibbs Court Farm is the {largest in England,}it separates the flowers from the leaves and stalks.The hops are loaded into ovens and dry in 3 hours.The dried hops are baled by pressing into a rectangular block.A cloth is put in the press,hops are shoveled in,pressed,a top cloth added, pressed again,the press opened,top and bottom cloths drawn together and the sides fastened. There is{concern}that fewer hops are being grown in this country now as {imported hops are cheaper}and are also used in the lighter and increasingly popular lagers.The continued use of English hops is being urged to prevent this branch of farming from dying out and disappearing from the landscape.
